ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We will brand him on the snout!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We shall brand him on the muzzle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Soon shall We brand him on his snout.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We shall brand him on his nose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We will soon singe his pig-nose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: We shall brand him on the snout (nose)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: We will brand him on the nose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We shall brand him upon the muzzle!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: We shall brand him on the nose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Soon We will brand him on the nose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Anon We shall brand him on snout.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Soon We shall brand him on his snout.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the snout!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: We shall brand him over the nose!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We shall mark him upon his nose!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We will brand him on the muzzle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: We will brand him upon the snout.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:16] We shall brand him on the snout: We shall leave a distinguishing mark upon his nose, one by which he will be reviled for as long as he lives; and so his nose was chopped off by a sword at Badr.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (We shall brand him on the nose) We shall hit him on the nose; and it is said this means: We shall hit him on the face; and it is also said this means: his face will be darkened. 683
